title: Boris Johnson to face questions on social care amid fears for Four Seasons
text:
Boris Johnson faces questions from MPs next week over the parlous state of the care home sector as the future of Four Seasons and its 16,000 residents hangs in the balance.

Four Seasons Health Care, which is the UK’s second-largest care home provider after HC-One, began withholding rent to landlords this month after its parent companies fell into administration in April.

The company has called in administrators Alvarez & Marsal to find a buyer but it is struggling to control costs amid a mounting £625m debt pile.

MPs warned more care homes could suffer a similar fate if the Government did not intervene.

Sarah Wollaston MP who is chair of the health and social care and liaison committees, said...
